publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1330 Mr John Home Robertson: Support for Rome Declaration-That the Parliament endorses the declaration of the assembly of world parliamentarians which met in Rome on 4 November 2000 on the urgent need for debt relief for poor countries, for positive action to tackle the disadvantages of globalisation, and to promote human dignity and freedom; acknowledges the significant progress made by Her Majesty's Government towards these objectives, and welcomes the decision of Pope John Paul II to designate Sir Thomas More as the patron saint of statesmen and politicians. Supported by: Michael Matheson*, Helen Eadie*, Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1330 Mr John Home Robertson: Support for Rome Declaration-That the Parliament endorses the declaration of the assembly of world parliamentarians which met in Rome on 4 November 2000 on the urgent need for debt relief for poor countries, for positive action to tackle the disadvantages of globalisation, and to promote human dignity and freedom; acknowledges the significant progress made by Her Majesty's Government towards these objectives, and welcomes the decision of Pope John Paul II to designate Sir Thomas More as the patron saint of statesmen and politicians. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Helen Eadie, Mr David Davidson
S1M-1330 Support for Rome Declaration (lodged on 9 November 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1330 Support for Rome Declaration (lodged on 9 November 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-1330 Support for Rome Declaration (lodged on 9 November 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Elaine Smith*, Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1330 Support for Rome Declaration (lodged on 9 November 2000) Michael Russell*
